two systems is one in which the systems are ",["$","em",null,{"children":"independent"}],".\nIntuitively speaking, two systems are independent if learning the classical state of either system has no effect on the probabilities associated with the other.\nThat is, learning what classical state one of the systems is in provides no information at all about the classical state of the other."],"className":"group paragraph-el text-text-primary mx-0"}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":["To define this notion precisely, let us suppose once again that
